project.teaser: Creating NEBourhoods Together will pave the way to make Munich-Neuperlach “New European Bauhaus-ready”. Neuperlach (NPL) was Germany's biggest post-war urban expansion area with about 65.000 inhabitants. To make this 50-year-old district fit for the future the City of...
project.objective: Creating NEBourhoods Together will pave the way to make Munich-Neuperlach “New European Bauhaus-ready”. Neuperlach (NPL) was Germany's biggest post-war urban expansion area with about 65.000 inhabitants. To make this 50-year-old district fit for the future the City of Munich set up an integrated urban concept and action plan based on comprehensive analysis of the challenges together with citizens and stakeholders in 2020/21. NPL faces weaknesses, e.g. higher than average unemployment and lower educational levels or high numbers of migration population. But it has strengths that, against the backdrop of these challenges, can become a breeding ground for a beautiful, sustainable and inclusive regeneration: strong social ties and bottom-up dynamics, vast green areas and largescale housing and office structures in need of renovation that can grow into something new. The City of Munich is committed to the EU-missions and aims at becoming a Climate-neutral and Smart City. In NPL, our test-bed for this mission, we will plant tangible pilots as lighthouse demonstrators and thus, going beyond urban regeneration so far, deliver NEBourhoods, inspiring and replicable nuclei of practises on the ground for the future of urban development. The partnership led by the City of Munich brings together UnternehmerTUM, TUM, HM University of Applied Sciences, Architekturgalerie Munich, NGOs and more. Combining co-creation and entrepreneurship, putting culture and creativity at the core of the transformation process, the project will deliver accessible and empowering solutions to make the EU-Green Deal beneficial for all in NPL and beyond. The district will be carefully cultivated into a resilient urban innovation landscape. Within two years, we will create NEBourhoods together and show how we can realise circular thinking and acting in society and economy, activate the green transformation in building, mobility, energy, food and health and enhance public space.
project.title: Creating NEBourhoods Together. Munich-Neuperlach as test-bed for urban innovation landscapes
project.keywords: New European Bauhaus, Integrated Development, Circularity, Urban Regeneration, Energy, Climate-neutral and Smart Cities, Co-Creation, Entrepreneurship, Arts, Culture

article.title: Making the Green Deal beneficial for all in Neuperlach

result.title: Circularity Roadmap for NPL
result.description: T4.4 The results of WP 4.4 will be integrated in a circularity roadmap for NPL to establish circular building and design practices for NPL in the long term. The roadmap will include circular design, construction and occupancy with the goal of reducing resource consumption, extending the use phase of buildings and objects, and closing material cycles.

result.title: Demonstration of structural extensions of residential buildings
result.description: T4.5 Documentation of design, demonstrator and evaluation of structural extensions of a residential building to provide opportunities for increased social interaction. The demonstrator will have a scale of 1:10 and will enable all stakeholders to evaluate aesthetical values, real life implementation potential and acceptance. It will form the basis of further development of a life size prototype not part of NEBourhoods, but implemented with further funding sources.

result.title: Strategy for widespread replication of key results
result.description: "T 6.3 In M5 a first version of the Replication Strategy will set the framework for all processes and actions. Their implementation will be designed as to enable evaluation and produce “material” that can feed into professionally designed communication, dissemination, and replication. The final Replication Strategy (D6.8 in M26) will be designed as to best reach out to the different target groups, including: -experts from all fields touched by NEB (architects, designers, engineers, ...) (EX); -cities and municipalities with the aim of holistic transformation to a smart and carbon neutral future (PUB), -public utilities (PU), -public and private housing companies (HOU), -businesses and start-ups for the Green Deal (BU), NGOs / NPOs ... as well as -policy makers (PO) at all levels (in Neuperlach, Munich and Europe). The final Replication Strategy will include the main tested and evaluated methods and results based on: NEB-processes:- NEBourhoods holistic approach for urban development (PUB, PO, education)- Transition-Hub methodology: integrating the cultural and creative dimension into a quadruple-helix co-creation process of urban transition led by NEB principles (WP2) (PUB, PO, education, EX)- Entrepreneurship process for empowering the Green Deal integrated in urban development - with a special focus on reaching out to a broader group of people beyond the ""innovation bubble"" (WP3) (PUB, PO, BU)NEB-actions:- ‘Animal-Aided-Design Toolbox’ and ‘Ecolope Design tool’ for increasing bio-diversity in (built-up) urban areas (PUB, HOU, BU)- ‘Renewable Energy Services’ (RES) by Energy Communities as well as an element of multifunctional NEB-solutions (PUB, PU, NGO/NPO) - ‘Public and public-private space planning and design’ to a) foster social interaction and a sense of belonging (special focus on youth in T5.5), b) enable multifunctional use (e.g. shading and RES), c) enable climate adaptation with multifunctional green infrastructure (linked to food chains) d) contribute to public (private) space design delivered by T5.2 “Mobility Hub” (PUB, HOU, NGO, BU)- ‘Circularity roadmap’ with a focus on non-housing as well as methods for redesigned housing stocks from the 1960s and 70s based on NEB-principlesIt also includes the further design, integration and implementation of ‘’NEBourhood activities’’ in the Integrated Action Concepts (‘Integriertes Handlungsraumkonzept’ – IHRK) in Neuperlach and other areas of the City of Munich (as appropriate)."

result.title: Demonstration of multifunctional mobility hubs
result.description: T5.2 Documentation of the co-creation, design, installation, monitoring & evaluation of two to three multifunctional mobility-hubs in Munich Neuperlach.

result.title: Co-creation workshops
result.description: T2.3 Documentation of the co-creation-workshop results and workshop formats.

result.title: Final strategy for widespread replication of key results
result.description: "T 6.3 In M5 a first version of the Replication Strategy will set the framework for all processes and actions. Their implementation will be designed as to enable evaluation and produce “material” that can feed into professionally designed communication, dissemination, and replication. The final Replication Strategy (D6.8 in M26) will be designed as to best reach out to the different target groups, including: -experts from all fields touched by NEB (architects, designers, engineers, ...) (EX); -cities and municipalities with the aim of holistic transformation to a smart and carbon neutral future (PUB), -public utilities (PU), -public and private housing companies (HOU), -businesses and start-ups for the Green Deal (BU), NGOs / NPOs ... as well as -policy makers (PO) at all levels (in Neuperlach, Munich and Europe). The final Replication Strategy will include the main tested and evaluated methods and results based on: NEB-processes:- NEBourhoods holistic approach for urban development (PUB, PO, education)- Transition-Hub methodology: integrating the cultural and creative dimension into a quadruple-helix co-creation process of urban transition led by NEB principles (WP2) (PUB, PO, education, EX)- Entrepreneurship program for delivering the Green Deal integrated in urban development - with a special focus on reaching out to a broader group of people beyond the ""innovation bubble"" (WP3) (PUB, PO, BU)NEB-actions:- ‘Animal-Aided-Design Toolbox’ and ‘Ecolope Design tool’ for increasing bio-diversity in (built-up) urban areas (PUB, HOU, BU)- ‘Renewable Energy Services’ (RES) by Energy Communities as well as an element of multifunctional NEB-solutions (PUB, PU, NGO/NPO) - ‘Public and public-private space planning and design’ to a) foster social interaction and a sense of belonging (special focus on youth in T5.5), b) enable multifunctional use (e.g. shading and RES), c) enable climate adaptation with multifunctional green infrastructure (linked to food chains) d) contribute to public (private) space design delivered by T5.2 “Mobility Hub” (PUB, HOU, NGO, BU)- ‘Circularity roadmap’ with a focus on non-housing as well as methods for redesigned housing stocks from the 1960s and 70s based on NEB-principlesIt also includes the further design, integration and implementation of ‘’NEBourhood activities’’ in the Integrated Action Concepts (‘Integriertes Handlungsraumkonzept’ – IHRK) in Neuperlach and other areas of the City of Munich (as appropriate)."

category.title: nongovernmental organizations
category.displayCode: /social sciences/political sciences/political policies/civil society/civil society organisations/nongovernmental organizations

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
